name: solutions_UpdateBusinessScenarios
description: Update the navigation property businessScenarios in solutions

$ul: **id**: The unique identifier for an entity. Read-only.
**createdBy**: The identity of the user who created the scenario.

**createdDateTime**: The date and time when the scenario was created. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.
**lastModifiedBy**: The identity of the user who last modified the scenario.

**lastModifiedDateTime**: The date and time when the scenario was last modified. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.
**ownerAppIds**: Identifiers of applications that are authorized to work with this scenario.
**planner**: Planner content related to the scenario.

**uniqueName**: Unique name of the scenario. To avoid conflicts, the recommended value for the unique name is a reverse domain name format, owned by the author of the scenario. For example, a scenario authored by Contoso.com would have a unique name that starts with com.contoso.
**client-request-id**: Client request Id as sent by the client application.
**request-id**: Request Id as tracked internally by the service
**client-request-id**: Client request Id as sent by the client application.
**request-id**: Request Id as tracked internally by the service
